messages: 3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:51): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: what do you think of edit-action event?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:51): 3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4, not sure.  Does such a thing exist yet, or is this just a proposal?  What are the use-cases?
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: so, some editors implement their own editing commands
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: or replace the UA's by their own
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: but there's currently no way of doing this
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: other than manually intercepting keydown
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:52): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: and other events
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:53): So just an event that fires whenever execCommand() is run?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:53): Are you talking about things like "user types text" or "user inserts a line break"?
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:53): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: we should fire an event for both
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:53): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: that's why I said user action
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:53): Right, I see.
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:53): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: could be beforeEditingCommand
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:53): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: or beforeEditingAction
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:53): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I mean the name could be anything
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:54): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: but the point is that we'll give some standard name for user editing actions
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:54): And the default action would be to run insertText or insertParagraph or whatever.
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:54): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: e.g. inserting new line should be InsertLineBreak / InsertParagraph, etc...
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:54): Why is this better than intercepting keydown etc.?
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:54): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I mean I'm certain UA already does this one way or another
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:54): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: intercepting keydown is problematic because it depends on each platform
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:55): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: e.g. ctrl+y doesn't necessary mean undo
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:55): Or Ctrl-Shift-Z.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:55): Okay, that makes sense.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:55): Also for insertLineBreak.
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:55): also, the user agent may provide some UI such as context menu that triggers editing commands
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:56): e.g. Safari provides Format in its context enu
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:56): and lets user bold, italicize, etc.. .text
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:56): Interesting.
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:56): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I guess we can talk more when we meet later this month :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:57): So it would make sense to just fire an event for every execCommand() invocation, whether internal to the browser or not.
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:58): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: but I'm not sure if all browsers go through execCommand internally when executing user editing actions
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:58): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: they might do something slightly different when actions are user triggerd
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (00:58): Right, that just has to be specced.
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:59): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: but I don't think I should be doing that in my spec
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:59): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: your spec is probably a better place to do
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:59): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: if you can give standarized names to each editing action
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:59): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: then I can refer to that in my spec
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (00:59): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I really want to tie all of this to new mutation events replacement though
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:00): Sounds good.
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (01:00): it seems like the discussion on that thread is bikeshedding to some extent now
3b630800966be5c4f7eb283c363eb7f4 (01:00): but ideally, script should be able to get a list of mutations that happened for a given edit action
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:02): Okay, go to go.  See you around.
